meanings.definition: One of a set of explicit or understood regulations or principles governing conduct within a particular activity or sphere.
meanings.sent1: The school has strict rules about behavior in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: Following the rules of the game is important to ensure fair play.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to have its own rules about when it wanted to be petted.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, breaking the rules can sometimes lead to innovative designs.
meanings.sent5: Learning the rules of a new language can be challenging but rewarding.

meanings.definition: A strip of wood or other rigid material used for measuring or as a straight edge in drawing or marking lines.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a long wooden rule to measure the length of the board.
meanings.sent2: She carefully placed the rule along the paper before drawing a straight line.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole the artist's rule and used it as a balance beam.
meanings.sent4: The rule of the ruler in the kingdom was absolute and unquestioned.
meanings.sent5: The precision of the rule helped the architect create accurate blueprints.
